channel.title: Toneburst Contributions
channel.description:
**Forum profile:** @toneburst **Contributor prefix:** toneburst
**Objects:**
* [toneburst/pattern/nmpgen2.axo](http://community.axoloti.com/t/toneburst-contributions/1468/37?u=toneburst) - pseudorandom pattern generator * [toneburst/pattern/nmpgen3.axo](http://community.axoloti.com/t/toneburst-contributions/1468/38?u=toneburst) - as above, but with trigger pattern output * [toneburst/math/interpolation-pow4.axo](http://community.axoloti.com/t/toneburst-contributions/1468/39?u=toneburst) - k-rate adjustable logarithmic to exponential interpolation * [toneburst/math/interpolation-bezier-quadratic.axo](http://community.axoloti.com/t/toneburst-contributions/1468/40?u=toneburst) - k-rate 1D quadratic Bezier interpolation * [toneburst/math/interpolation-bezier-cubic.axo](http://community.axoloti.com/t/toneburst-contributions/1468/41?u=toneburst) - k-rate 1D cubic Bezier interpolation * [Talkie Toolkit](http://community.axoloti.com/t/toneburst-contributions/1468/42?u=toneburst) - a collection of modules based on Texas Instruments LPC emulation [in development]
**patches:** none yet
**firmware:** none

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @toneburst alx
item.description:
@toneburst wrote:

Actually, the sample-recording and LPC analysis is the only thing it has over my LPC objects. They go Waaaay further in terms of sonic-mangling potential.

a|x

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @toneburst alx
item.description:
@toneburst wrote:

The new Teenage Engineering PO-35 Speak has kinds stolen my thunder, when it comes to LPC

It's even implemented sample-analysis, too (which is what I planned to do next, but never got around to).

a|x

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @toneburst alx
item.description:
@toneburst wrote:

I'm not a good programmer, I'm afraid, as I have no formal training so it might all seem a bit of a mess, to a more experienced coder, to be honest.

My objects were actually originally based on the Talkie library, but I realised after a while that Talkie was based on a previous port (by the MAME emulation guys), and I went back to the earlier source, and added elements back in that had been removed from Talkie.

a|x

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

hmm, i will try to have a go at it. since the talkie library approach is exactly that (loading arrays via the say(); function, it should indeed be possible (your lpc objects are based on the talkie stuff). a quick look at the code gave me no idea where to start though

a browser tool for creating custom vsm data would be killer!!!

hmm, i guess i will have to wait a little for this to happen or dig deep into your code to get a better understanding of how you handle the stuff...

thanks anyhow!

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @toneburst alx
item.description:
@toneburst wrote:

Hi @lokki,

I’m sure that would be possible. I’m afraid I’ve got tied up in other projects, and haven’t looked at the LPC objects for a long time.

I’ll try and have a look at them again soon. In the meantime, you’re more than welcome to give it a go yourself. Another object for loading LPC data would definitely be a useful addition to the set.

In the longer term, I’d ideally like to create some kind of (maybe browser-based) tool for creating custom VSM banks.

a|x

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

hi @toneburst i know this is an "old" set of objects but it would be really great to add one object to these. a loader for pure lpc streams... that way one could create his own set of words/phrases and save them in a file on the sd card (or put the hex code directly into the object, i don't care). looking at the vsm loader i think pure hex-streams (from qboxpro or blue wizard) should be easier to parse. could you be bothered to create such a loader? or do you have any hints where i could start with coding this? vsm_rom_data_sdram seems to hold the lpc streams, right?

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @smuff Simon Smith
item.description:
@smuff wrote:

That is great news thank you very much. Hope you have a good break and hope to hear from you in a few days. Best. S

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @toneburst alx
item.description:
@toneburst wrote:

@lokki that's cool. I'll send you both the .axp when I get home on the 28th.

a|x

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

@toneburst

i would also be open for some beta testing!! very nice sounds.

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @toneburst alx
item.description:
@toneburst wrote:

@smuff hi, no more progress sadly. Everything is pretty much working, though.

I wanted to clean up the code and create a library of some of the common functions before breaking out all the embedded custom objects into external ones, and haven't had time to do that, sadly.

I'm away from home until the 28th, but I can send you the .axp file when I get back if you like- the whole object set is in there.

I'd be really interested to get your feedback on them, actually, if you're up for doing a bit of beta-testing, and that might spur me on to knocking them into a releasable state.

a|x

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions

item.description:
@smuff wrote:

Any More news?? Hope things are progressing...

Read full topic

item.description:
@smuff wrote:

No problem. Looking forward to it!!

Read full topic

Hi @smuff I got a bit distracted making Euro modules. Also, I got a bit stuck for a name prefix for the object. I'll try and get the suite released one-by-one, when I get a chance.

a|x

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

toneburst:

The other slight issue is that the VSM files it reads are still technically covered by copyright, so I'm not sure I should distribute them directly (@johannes?) . I can drop some heavy hints as to where you might find them, though

if its copyrighted material then no do not upload, and do not point to any site that could be considered warez / pirate or will infringe copyright.
we cannot stop users searching for these files, if they have the will to do so.

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @hellcore
item.description:
@hellcore wrote:

I strongly suggest you leave it to the user to deal with the VSM files. Make it super clear in your object post/help file that they are required.

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @toneburst alx
item.description:
@toneburst wrote:

Sorry about that, but thanks!

They're a bit of a labour of love- love those S&S sounds!

I'll get them released as soon as I can. Have to re-style the code squash a few minor bugs, and come up with some help files.

The other slight issue is that the VSM files it reads are still technically covered by copyright, so I'm not sure I should distribute them directly (@johannes?) . I can drop some heavy hints as to where you might find them, though

a|x

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @MrBim Bim
item.description:
@MrBim wrote:

The lpc objects look awesome.
I got all excited, then couldn't find the in the library, now I'm a little sad.
Can't wait to get my hands on them.

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @smuff Simon Smith
item.description:
@smuff wrote:

Good luck. Let us know when,you are happy with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @toneburst alx
item.description:
@toneburst wrote:

Thank you. There are still a few things I want to add. Interpolation is the first.

The Arduino library I originally based the objects on ('Talkie' by Peter Knight) didn't have any inter-frame interpolation, largely because of processor limitations of the Arduino's 8-bit ATMega328 MCU I think. However, the MAME code that that library is based on reproduced the original TI toys' bit-shift based interpolation. My next task is to add that to the Tables object.

a|x

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @smuff Simon Smith
item.description:
@smuff wrote:

Your implementation is much better!

Read full topic

Cool!

I had thought it would be cool to control a GinSing/SoundGin chip from the Axoloti.

a|x

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @smuff Simon Smith
item.description:
@smuff wrote:

I have lots of LPC implementations in Max MSP, Bitspeek VST and ChipSpeech VST and a GinSing Arduino, but I very much like yours. Good luck look forward to playing with the results.Best of luck.S

Read full topic

item.title: Toneburst Contributions
item.dc:creator: @toneburst alx
item.description:
@toneburst wrote:

Wow, thanks... It's something of a labour of love for me, I have to say. I've had a thing for the old S&S toys for some time now (even own both the French and Italian models, though not the German one- that's the Holy Grail).

I keep thinking of new things to add, and little tweaks to make. Shouldn't be too long before I feel they're ready to be released in to the wild, though, I think.

a|x

Read full topic
